topic.title: HPE Helion 1.0 Development Platform: Commercial Installation and Configuration

body.p: The HPE Helion Development Platform currently contains four products: Application Lifecycle Service (ALS), Marketplace Service, Messaging Service and Database Service.
The following topics explain how to install and configure the HPE Helion Development Platform.
NOTE: If you are installing the HPE Helion Development Platform Community edition, follow the HPE Helion Development Community Installation and Configuration instructions instead.

li.xref: Installing the HPE Helion Development Platform

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The HPE Helion Development Platform is installed in the overcloud of HPE Helion OpenStack

The system running the installer needs to have Python 2.7. Most modern operating systems include this as part of their base toolkit. This document is geared toward a Linux operating system but this does not preclude the installer from running on other operating systems with some minor modifications to the command-line statements herein.
The installer requires the following packages. If they are not found, it will prompt you to install them.

section.title: Installing the HPE Helion Development Platform
Downloading and unpacking the installation file
section.p: The installation of the HPE Helion Development Platform for the HPE Helion OpenStack Commercial Edition is provided as a small compressed tar file. The images for the actual services will be downloaded at the installer's request.
Note: Should you need more assistance during installation, the install script also has a help feature.

li.p: Register and download the package from the HPE Helion Development Platform
Before you begin the installation, unpack the tar file.
Run this command to create and populate a dev-platform-installer directory.
If your network uses a proxy, it may be necessary to set the proxy shell variable.

codeblock.codeph: export https_proxy=<ip address or url of http proxy>

li.p: Run this command to prepare the installer and ensure prerequisites are met.
Optionally, you can specify the Username, Tenant and Region at this time. By default the Username is admin, the Tenant Name is admin and the Region is regionOne.

section.title: Install the Messaging Service
section.p: This section provides details on installing the Messaging service from the Development Platform.

li.p: Open Horizon and log in as the "admin" user. Then click on the Admin panel in Horizon and select Development Platform. Finally, click Configure Services.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services screen and enter your username and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network. Select the Sign-up button if you do not have an account.

section.title: Download and Configure the Messaging Service

li.p: In the Configure Services panel locate the Messaging item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.
Once the download is complete, click the Configure Service button to configure the Messaging Service and wait for the configuration step to complete.
Log out from the Horizon dashboard. Log back into the Horizon dashboard as a non-admin user and click on the Messaging panel under the current Project to begin using the Messaging Service.

section.title: Install the Application Lifecycle Service (ALS)
section.p: This section provides details on installing the Application Lifecycle service from the Development Platform.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: For ALS to install dependencies for deployed applications, you must provide ALS with outbound Internet connectivity. This process is documented in Step 7 of "Starting the seed and building your cloud" in the baremetal installation instructions. If an HTTP Proxy is required for Internet downloads, follow the instructions in the Administration Guide.

li.p: Open Horizon and log in as the "Admin" user. Then click on the Admin panel in Horizon and select Development Platform. Finally, click on Configure Services.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services panel and enter your username and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network. Select the Sign-up button if you do not have an account.

section.title: Download and Configure the Application Lifecycle Service

li.p: In the Configure Services panel locate the Application Lifecycle Service item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.
Once the download is complete, click the Configure Service button to configure the Application Lifecycle Service and wait for the configuration step to complete.

Log out from the Horizon dashboard. Log back into the Horizon dashboard as a non-admin user and click on the Application Lifecycle Service panel under the current Project to being using Application Lifecycle Services.

section.title: Install the Database Service
section.p: This section provides details on installing the Database Service from the Development Platform.

section.title: Availability Zones
section.p: To configure the Database Service in a highly available manner, it is necessary to create separate availability zones for the compute hosts in the service. The following steps show how to create three availability zones and assign a compute host to the zone.

li.p: Connect to an overcloud controller node and execute the following commands to create three availability zones named: "AZ-1", "AZ-2" and "AZ-3".

codeblock.codeph: nova aggregate-create aggregate-AZ-1 AZ-1 nova aggregate-create aggregate-AZ-2 AZ-2 nova aggregate-create aggregate-AZ-3 AZ-3

li.p: Validate that the availability zones were correctly created by issuing the following command.
nova aggregate-list
The following commands will add a compute host to your newly created availability zones. Issue this command for every compute host that you wish to associate with an availability zone.
The following command can be used to list all availability zones and the compute hosts associated with them.

li.p: Open Horizon and login as the "admin" user. Then click on the admin panel in Horizon and select the Development Platform panel under Admin. Then click on the Configure Services sub-panel.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services panel and enter your username and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network. Select the Sign-up button if you do not have an account.

section.title: Download and Configure the Database Service
section.p: In the Configure Services panel locate the Database Service item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.

li.p: Once the download is complete, click the Configure Service button to begin configuration of the service. In the configuration dialog, specify the following configuration options:
Key Pair (Required) - Key Pair to install on all instances created as part of the database service. The public key can be used by an admin to get SSH access to all instances.
External Network (Required) - Network Name for the network that has external network access. For HPE Helion OpenStack Commercial Edition this network is named 'ext-net'
NTP Server IP - IP Address to an NTP server to use if instances will not have outbound access to the internet.
Service User Password (Required) - The password for the Admin user that is currently logged in. This password MUST match the password used to login to Horizon.
Icinga User Password (Required) - Specify a password for the Icinga service that is created as part of the install. Keep this password for future use.
Volume Type (Required) - The volume type to use when creating database instances.
Enable HA - Specify if the database service is to be setup in an HA configuration. If selected, each component of the service will have three instances created and active at all times.
RabbitMQ IP Address (Required) - Specify the IP address of the central Helion OpenStack Logstash server.
After all configuration options have been provided, select the Configure button to complete the configuration step. Wait for the configuration step to complete and the status to change to Configured.

section.title: Install the Marketplace Service
section.p: This section provides details on installing the Marketplace service from the Development Platform.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The Marketplace Service will be installed into the admin tenant of the HPE Helion OpenStack overcloud and the admin tenant must have sufficient quota available and unused for the resources the service uses. To check existing quota availability, log-in to Horizon as the admin user and open the Overview panel under the Compute tab.

li.p: Open Horizon and log in as the "admin" user. Then click on the admin panel in Horizon and select the Development Platform Panel under Admin. Then click on the Configure Services sub-panel.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services panel and enter your username and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network. Select the Sign-up button if you do not have an account.

section.title: Download and Configure the Marketplace Service
section.p: In the Configure Services panel locate the Application Lifecycle Service item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.

li.p: Once the download is complete, click the Configure Service button to begin configuration of the service. In the configuration dialog, specify the following configuration options:
Key Pair (Required) - Key Pair to install on all instances created as part of the marketplace service. The public key can be used by an admin to get SSH access to all instances.
External Network (Required) - Network Name for the network that has external network access. For HPE Helion OpenStack Commercial Edition this network is named 'ext-net'
NTP Server IP - IP Address to an NTP server to use if instances will not have outbound access to the internet.
Service User Password (Required) - The password for the Admin user that is currently logged in. This password MUST match the password used to login to Horizon.
Subnet Range - The subnet to use for Marketplace
Do not attempt to install any Marketplace packages yet. Log out from the Horizon dashboard.
Log back into the Horizon dashboard and click on the Marketplace panel under the current Project to begin using the Marketplace Service. You may now install Marketplace packages.

section.title: Service is stuck in download
section.p: There are several situations in which a download will not complete. One cause which is documented, is because the tmp directory ran out of space. There is a prerequisite to mount the tmp directory to a larger partition. If you have completed this and it is still failing to download then we will need to reset the download. In the current release, this requires a manual process.

Log in to the "admin" tenant as the "admin" user. Click on Project and then click Object Store. Open the sherpa-cache folder and delete the wscatalog folder which contains the cached download. The service should now be available to download again.
